text: Edward Janiak (14 August 1952 – 23 September 2021) was a Polish bishop of the Roman Catholic Church. He served as the Bishop of Kalisz from 2012 to 2020. == Early life and education == Janiak was born in Malczyce, Poland. He was ordained a priest on 19 May 1979 by Wincenty Urban. == Ecclesiastical career == Janiak served in various roles in the Church. He became an auxiliary bishop of Wrocław in 1996. In 2012, he was appointed as the Bishop of Kalisz. == Scandals and controversies == In 2020, Janiak was accused of covering up cases of sexual abuse by priests in his diocese. He resigned as Bishop of Kalisz in October 2020. A Vatican investigation into his actions was underway at the time of his death. == Death == Edward Janiak died on 23 September 2021 in Warsaw, Poland. == References == == Other websites == * Profile at Catholic- Hierarchy Category:1952 births Category:2021 deaths Category:Polish Roman Catholic bishops Category:Catholic Church sexual abuse scandals
